subject: p14147787
History: Year old man with sarcoid and recent increase in cough and DOE, assess for any worsening in parenchymal infiltrates in preparation for possible re-starting of steroids assess for any worsening in parenchymal infiltrates in preparation for possible re-starting of steroids.
Impression: Compared to chest radiographs since, most recently. Greater wall thickening in the regions of bilateral upper lobe scarring and traction bronchiectasis with respect to raises possibility of superinfection. Lower lungs grossly clear. Heart size normal. No pleural effusion. Calcifications noted in central lymph nodes, but there is no evidence of increased adenopathy.
